Topic.Title: No joy for Yahoo China as e-mail service to close April 19th, 2013

Message.Msg: Interesting development, and while probably a sound economic decision, it may be problematic for Yahoo from a PR and brand image perspective. IF, and I use IF deliberately, a significant number of Yahoo China email users were enrolled because of the "stablity" "US branding" and "cache" of having a Yahoo account they MAY NOT be inclined to simply slide on over to "just another Chinese" provider. We all know loyalty matters, particularly in China, and those "spurned" email users may just be put off to all things Yahoo from here on out. Six months of usage data should tell the tale.

Topic.Title: Buy Yahoo under $23 while you can...

Message.Msg: "asian assets" or its Ali Baba stake will be worthless and never go public. As someone who spends a considerable amount of time in Shanghai, I can guarantee you that Ali baba wont list on the exchange because the Chinese do not trust the stock market. In fact all their assets are tied up in a major property bubble that is about to burst, leaving their economy in shambles. AKA a substantial drop in the use of ali baba and a major reassessment of risk and valuation in the "asian assets". I also just got back for Athens and Zurich this month and can tell you just how bad the macro-economics are in Europe and that the massive push for the EBU might not go through in time to save the banking system, which is substantially worse than it was in 2009 and substantially worse than our banking system during the Lehman Failure.

Message.Title: Look for CCUR to make big gains next week!
Message.Msg: Next week's hottest play could be CCUR it could potentially be the most undervalued stock with the largest upside potential on the NASDAQ today. It is only $6.60 with 8.72mm shares outstanding and a market cap of $57.55mm. It has $24.6mm in cash and no debt. Enterprise value is only $33mm or just 0.52X its trailing revenues of $63mm. Their 2Q 2013 EPS was up 100% from 1Q 2013 and their 1Q 2013 EPS was up 100% from 4Q 2012. Their 3Q 2013 EPS is coming soon! If you watch video on demand (VOD) services through cable TV and subscribe to the services of Time Warner Cable, Cox, Charter, or Bright House, CCUR provides your VOD services. They also just signed an unnamed top 5 North American pay-TV company to a VOD contract! CCUR last month signed a multi-screen TV deal for video delivery to smartphones and tablets with Virgin Media (VMED) the #1 cable TV company in the UK. CCUR's EPS is likely to continue soaring in the upcoming quarters!

Topic.Title: update on Asian Asset values

Message.Msg: Last year two of Alibaba’s portals together handled $170 billion in sales, more than eBay and Amazon combined. Alibaba is on track to become the world’s first e-commerce firm to handle $1 trillion a year in transactions. Facebook’s IPO valued the company at $104 billion, though its market capitalization has slipped back to $63 billion. Estimates of the likely valuation of Alibaba range from $55 billion to more than $120 billion.
